title: Encrypting and fully wiping data from Mate 9

thread.text:
Hi,
I'm returning my Mate 9 and looking to wipe the data from it. I've read in numerous articles that to fully wipe an android phone I should encrypt my phone then factory reset it. However, I can't find the encrypt option on the Mate 9. So I have two questions...
1. Is the Mate 9 encrypted by default?
2. Does anyone know if I'm able to encrypt on the Mate 9?
3. If not, is there another way to encrypt/fully wipe data from the Mate 9? Someone suggested using an app such as "Secure Erase with iShredder 4", do these apps actually work?
Thanks in advance.

replies.text:
1 - As far as I have learned, no.
2 - Same - no.
3 - I'd like to know the answer too.

That's what I understand as well, but when I go to Memory and Storage, and change the default from internal to SD card storage, a pop up message displays saying my phone has been encrypted and to make sure the external storage is as well. But then there appears to be conflicting comments saying it isn't.

thread.text:
Found on XDA
Mate 9 is NOT encrypted.
This will be available in the future.https://forum.xda-developers.com/mat...ption-t3515229

replies.text: Thanks. This is a big concern as I understand from Marshmallow onwards the higher end android smartphones are required to be encrypted.

thread.text: How is this even an option with Nougat??? I believe 7.0 has file level encryption on by default?https://www.android.com/versions/nougat-7-0/

replies.text: This is what I heard too, but all or most other android phones also have the option to manually encrypt so I'm very surprised and confused as to why Huawei have taken this option away.

thread.text:
Wonder if encryption is out of the hands of user is all. Not an "option" because you can't turn it off, it is baked right in. 
When I set up a new SD card it asked - or told me - that was it.

replies.text: If this is the case then that's fine but there seems to be no confirmation of this anywhere

thread.text: Did they take it away, or it on by default and no option to disable.

replies.text: I don't know, I did some research today and the information is conflicting. I've asked Huawei for clarification, waiting to hear back from them. It would seem very odd if there was no encryption, especially for a high end phone like the Mate 9 and the fact Google have made it a requirement to have encryption by default in Nougat.

thread.text:
For the record.... here is the response I got when I asked about encryption on Amazon...............Hello Paul, the 9 is very secure. It does include an encrypted file safe for everything you put on the device. It also comes with 4 Level fingerprint which you can set to access your encrypted data. (DM) - HuaweiDeviceUSAService answered on January 14, 2017
To me, that answers the question. No, the phone is not encrypted.
I have to wonder if it is CPU related? Many much cheaper phones with a Qualcomm CPU can be encrypted.

Since the device requires a pin after restart, that would indicate the use of "Direct Boot", which is related to the new file based encryption in 7.0. Hence, device is encrypted.
Biggest mystery seems to be why Huawei representatives can't answer this fairly simple question.

title: Anyone found a charger that fast charges the Mate 9 like the OEM charger?

thread.text:
I would like to get a second fast charging A/C adapter and cable? 
Does the Nexus 6P one work? Do you have to use a special USB-C cable? Anyone buy one online that works (and is safe)?
Thanks!

The charger is important and so is the cord. 
Charger needs to charge @4.5volts and 5 amps and the cord needs to accept 5 amps for super charge. Most cords only accept 2 
amps and are limited to fast charging. I tried my 5 amp cord that came with the Mate 9 on my Honor 8 5 volt/2 amp charger and it fast charged the Mate 9. I ordered a couple of 5 amp cords and will use them on either charger and will be able to get the Mate super charge and the Honor 8 fast charge. The fast charge pumps about 2500 may while the Super charge is pumping close to twice that. 
If you have a Nexus 6P charger and 5 amp cord it should fast charge.
Its a proprietary charger, like the OnePlus. I think you need the original.

replies.text: I am using a Huawei Honor 8 charger and cord and it shows fast charge on the Mate 9 the same as it does on the Honor 8. If you use the charger and cord that comes with the Mate 9 it shows supercharge. I don't see much difference in charge time.

If that's the case then you can get the huaw honor gift box which comes with charger, cable, usb c adapter and selfie stick for$9 if you need a genuine Huawei charger.https://www.amazon.com/Huawei-Gift-B...cUvbUpU5653619

thread.text: The s7 quick charger only shows regular charging, the pixel charger shows fast charging and the Huawei one says super charging. This leads me to think that Huawei will only support fast charging on the USB c power delivery standard since that's what the pixel charger is.

replies.text: The Huawei Mate 9 charger does super charging and the Honor 8 charger does fast charging.

title: What kind of glass is on this phone?

thread.text: Gorilla? I want to determine the scratch potential if i got without screen protector.
https://www.androidpit.com/huawei-ma...-build-quality - this website says it will be protected against scratches, etc with Gorilla Glass 3.
Thanks! I forgot about AndroidPit. I need to check them out again.

replies.text: No problem! I was curious about the glass, myself!

thread.text: Personally I prefer GG3 over 4 or 5. Now that nearly all new phones have this 2.5 curved glass it's nearly impossible to find a tempered glass screen protector that fits properly. GG3 is harder and more scratch resistant which is what is needed when you can't find a good glass screen protector. GG4 and 5 are more flexible thereby being more shatterproof (although it's really not that much better if the phone falls on its corner without a case). But being more flexible and plastic-like also makes GG4 and 5 more prone to scratches! So for me I wish all phones had FLAT glass so no matter which Gorilla Glass is installed at least I could get a good tempered glass screen protector for it!

title: Notification bar bug? Lock screen notifications? 4G keeps turning off? Help pls

thread.text:
Hey guys!
I just bought my Huawei Mate 9 and coming from a two year old Oneplus One i can say it feels like flying, but at the same time I seem to been having some problems, I don't know if it is EMUI that works this way, but I find this next things serious problems more than annoyances.
1. First there is the notification bar, nothing wrong with it when I'm at the home screen, but when I go into an app it seems to vanish and the only way to know what's going on in my phone is to manually pull it down. Is there any solution to this? Is it a bug with EMUI 5.0?
*there is a white bar at the top of the next picture where the notification bar is supposed to be, it's not a space between the lines of text*
2. Somewhat of a related problem, when I'm at my lock screen, I can never see ANY notification, the only thing I see is the time and my step counter, this is a very serious problem, I should be able to have a glimpse of my notifications at my lockscreen.
3. Finally there has been some times when I notice that my phone is loading slowly internet sites, and then I realize that the 4G option at the quick menu from the pull down notification bar has been turned off, this has happened several times, I thought it was because it could not find a LTE signal so it turned itself off, but when turning it back on it automatically goes into 4G/LTE. What's going on? Why does it turn itself off automatically?
I really need to know if this is an EMUI thing or something I can change or fix, 
Thanks in advance guys.

Hey Ernesto, regarding the notification bar not showing up inside apps, I don't have this issue. Maybe try turning off the carrier name (Telcel).
I think number 2 is by design, mine doesn't show the notification bar either.
I can't say that I've had an issue with 4g(I'm on Telcel also) but I haven't been out of 4g range since i got the phone last week.
Saludos,
Neil.

Now that I tried it on other apps it seems to be a problem with only the amazon app. Anyway I really really don't see me trying to hear everytime I get a notification, or even when I'm busy and I'm trying to check my phone with a quick glimpse. Anyone has a fix for this?
Maybe the 4G problem is an automatic thing, will have to keep an eye on it.
Thanks,
Ernesto

Ernesto, in order to see notifications on the lockscreen, you first need to go into the Notification and status bar setting. From there open notification management, and in there you can individually select which apps can appear on the lockscreen.

thread.text: Haven't tested it out yet, got it evening and was taking some inside shots and mono chrome shots. Will have to compare with my Pixel in the next few days.

Ok, so I've had a couple days to play with the mate 9 and these are my thoughts:
Screen: Wow! This screen is amazing! I can't get over how much nicer it is compared to the 6P and I can see it outside. When I ordered the mate 9 I felt that I was taking a step backwards due to its lower screen resolution but obviously specs don't tell the whole story.
Size: I really didn't want a large phone and was pleasantly surprised that the mate 9 is almost the exact same size as the 6P.
Battery: I'm not a heavy user but I do have all services turned on at all times. I definitely finish the day with more left over than the 6P but that's to be expected from its larger capacity.
Radios: I get 4g in places that the 6P would not.
Speed: I had no issue with speed on the 6P but the mate 9 is snappier.
Speakers: another area that I felt was going to be a step backwards as the 6P has dual speakers. The mate 9 does a good job using the bottom speaker and the phone speaker to produce good sound.
EMUI: after several years of vanilla Android I'm really enjoying this skin. 
Finger print reader: Damn that thing is fast and accurate!
Camera: I haven't really had enough time to play with it yet so I can't really comment at this point (although I did take some very nice shots last night in manual mode, playing with iso and shutter speed.....I think I might pickup a mini tripod).
Things I miss about my 6P:
Ambient display: as I use my phone as my alarm clock, I miss not having the ambient display on at night to show me the time. I guess that's got to do with the difference in screen technology (LCD vs amoled).
Do not disturb mode: on the mate 9 there's no option to automatically turn off do not disturb mode after the alarm goes off.
LED notification light could be larger.
So far I'm really happy with this thing.

Settings : Fingerprint ID : touch to stop an alarms, touch and hold to answer calls. 
Other action settings on that page as well.

I thought about getting Pixel XL few times and by the time I really wanted to do it. It was just not available and I lost interest. I picked up Axon 7 and returned it due to few issues. I was going to order OP 3T, again not available and lost interest. Saw Mate 9 at Best buy and love how it looks and perform, I bought it and loving it. Beautiful phone, camera is great.

thread.text:
I've played with all 3 so far.
Auto mode on the Lg v20 camera has some pretty intense image processing--maybe a bit too aggressive. But it has a pro mode so if you modify things manually, you can get really good results. But obviously a bit of a learning curve. In terms of audio and microphones, very high quality. But again...do you need this?
worst battery life of the three, but you can swab to a new battery if you want--and had a spare.
Auto image processing on the pixel xl is really good and part of the reason why its a great camera--auto mode produces great results. But...no pro mode .
Battery life on the pixel xl is very good.
I just got the mate 9--but it should have a bit better camera than the lg v20--not as automatic as the pixel but the software isn't so aggressive on image processing. And the dual camera can produce some pretty neat effects. And it has a pro mode--but there is a steep learning curve.

software wise...pixel is in a class by itself
lg v20 has nougat...
mate 9 also has emui over nougat but still pretty stock...
can't really go wrong with any of them. But mate 9 has micro sd as does lg v20...

If somebody put a gun to my head, I'd probably go with the Pixel first, Mate 9 then the V20. But the reasoning for the order largely boils down to personal preference.

thread.text: if you use the hangouts dialer app while connected to wifi it will call using wifi or if your not connected to wifi it will use ur data connection.

I notice that when I turn on the hotspot feature on the Mate 9, other devices connected to the Mate 9 can access internet, but the Mate 9 itself can no longer connect to the Internet at all. Can anyone else confirm if this is only me or a software glitch? Thanks.

Welcome to Android Central! Are you talking about the Mate 9 accessing internet via wi-fi or mobile data? If the wi-fi hotspot is on, the phone can't connect to wi-fi itself. It can only transmit its mobile data signal as a wi-fi hotspot to other devices.

When I turn on wi-fi hotspot on the Mate 9, devices connected to Mate 9 can access internet via the mobile data from the Mate 9. Mate 9 itself cannot access mobile data. All apps on the phone would say no internet connection even when devices connected to the Mate 9 hotspot can access mobile data.
Model: MHA-L29
Build number: MHA-L29C636B110
That is strange. Is there anything in the hotspot settings menu that might help? (I'm not sure if the Mate 9's menu is any different from the one on my Nexus 6P.)
Nope, It's like the standard tethering menu. I wondering if this a bug in the firmware build that I'm using.
I figured out what the issue is. My carrier have a tethering APN which seems to be causing the problem. Once I delete the tethering APN entry, I can access Internet while I have hotspot turn on.

Before you think I have more money than sense, you're probably right but no other phone that I am aware of offers all that the Porsche variant of the Mate9 does. 
It's good no question but after an afternoon of playing around/setting it up these are the quirks I've found so far:
1. The way it handles the 2 SIM cards is odd. Samsung & HP have this licked and on first using the Mate 9 I kept seeing a recording logo in the top left of the display. I thought (incorrectly) it was an O2 recording. It wasn't - it was Sim no. 2 - on EE. How the hell so you get the message? There is no way of toggling between the Sims. I found a way, turn off making one sim or another being a default. That way you can (if you have bionic eye balls) see which SIM has a voice message waiting and select sim 1 or 2 accordingly to dial 901. Check out how simple (and obvious) it is on a Samsung Dual SIM Note 5 for example. 
2. The auto-brightness just doesn't work. It jumps up and down like a yo-yo and scrolls right back to minimum brightness in a low lit room. It is far too aggressive. 
3. Call Recorder Pro doesn't work. I'm hoping its a Nougat thing as the m9 is running Android 7. Let's hope so. 
4. Total finger magnet. I hate black phones but there is no choice with the Porsche Design version. 
6. The flimsy cheap looking case is poor. And because the PD Mate9 is relatively unique, there is no choice for others bar a Tonka-toy looking one from EBay/Mobile Fun if you want to pay quadruple from the latter supplier. 
Is it otherwise good? So far yes superb, but totally overpriced and lacking in wireless charging....

I completely agree... 
I purchased one yday.. Went out to buy either a Galaxy s7 edge or Google pixel but 3 central London shops turned me away because they were saving their stock for contracts rather than sim free... 
I had been in touch with the Porsche Design store a few weeks before and decided to have a look there. 
The manager remembered me from our emails... 
He showed the handset off and explained everything about it and I preferred it to the other phones... 
It's also about the service... 
Phone is AMAZING and so far I can't fault it.. Ok expensive but so is the Google pixel on or off contract. 
I had a note 7 and samsungs service left a bad taste in my mouth with the way their customer service treated me so I'm very happy I decided to buy this

I was tempted by the specs, and as a Pcar owner it would have been nice, but I decided to go for a 6GB/128GB white Mate 9 at half the price of the P phone. Half the memory but it should be adequate for my needs. Having said that, the P version looks awesome...enjoy.

title: Dual camera will become the new trend of smart phones

thread.text:
This spring, LG and Huawei have led the way with their new Android flagships, introducing two very different dual-camera systems indicating that the entire industry is about to enter the "dual camera era”.
Some consumers may think that the dual-camera smart phone is flashy without substance. Instead of using dual cameras,it’s better to develop a better camera.In their view,the smartphones camera performance in low light conditions is still weak, so the current core issue is the quality of the camera defects, rather than the lack of quantity.
However, if the number of smart phone camera, can improve the image quality, why not? 
Compared with mirrorless camera or SLR cameras which has large size of the sensor chip, smart phone camera want to achieve their quality, there is a long way to go. But it must also can be seen that smart phone camera is good enough nowadays.With the development of small sensor hardware and the progress of auto HDR,enable smartphone cameras to meet a variety of scenarios, and if the picture is viewed on the device screen, the quality is good enough.
However,on the camera sensor technology progress, the problems is the return is getting smaller. As a matter of fact, take a look at Google Web album statistics ,can know that today's smart phone users, has been considered their phone camera is good enough to take pictures.In other words, a slight improvement in the sensor, such as better pixels or low light conditions to enhance the quality, it is difficult to bring great changes to the phone camera, smart phone manufacturers need other generous action, to make their shooting function stand out.
Through the dual cameras hardware can record DOF of the picture, can be perceived to be photographed objects near and far, so you can separate the object and background, even to make fuzzy processing background, can realize the function of adjusting pictures DOF in the latter part,of course, user can choose any position on the photo as focus, which may come to different photo effects. In addition, you can take a photo of the 3D effect (tilt Angle of the fuselage can watch), four seasons, and provides a virtual 360 degree panoramic camera, etc. 
It can be said that dual cameras will become the new trend in smartphones, bring new development direction for smart phone manufacturers.
Sumvier K20 is the first one released dual cameras between OEM manufacturers,its dual camera is two-in-one, rather than running separately, the distance between the two cameras are very exquisite ,the working principle just like Huawei P9,can greatly enhance the camera quality,Which is most of the second-tier brand phone not able to do.
